sections.content: Calligraphy content is hypnotic—the flow of ink, the formation of letters, the satisfying result. Viewers want to see technique clearly: pen angle, pressure variation, and ink flow. The meditative quality of calligraphy has ASMR appeal. Here's what successful calligraphy YouTubers use.

faq.question: Best overhead setup for calligraphy?
faq.answer: Copy stand most stable for flat work. C-stand with boom arm for larger setups. Elgato arm for desk-mounted solutions. Key is zero movement while writing. Position camera directly overhead.

faq.question: How to avoid hand shadows?
faq.answer: Dual light sources from opposite sides. Diffused lights reduce harsh shadows. LED panels at 45-degree angles work well. Test with your actual writing position before filming.

faq.question: Should I include pen sounds?
faq.answer: Yes—calligraphy sounds are ASMR gold. Nib scratching on paper, ink flow, satisfying strokes. Quiet room and close microphone placement. Many viewers watch specifically for the sounds.

faq.question: Real-time or sped up?
faq.answer: Both have audiences. Real-time is meditative and educational. Time-lapse shows longer pieces efficiently. Many creators do both—real-time process, time-lapse for complex pieces.
